meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The owl will skreegh loudly at night.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate began to skreegh as it opened.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to skreegh like a bird, but it sounded funny.
meanings.sent4: The brakes on the old car started to skreegh like a banshee.
meanings.sent5: The microphone feedback made the singer's voice skreegh unpleasantly.

meanings.sent1: The skreegh of the alarm woke everyone up.
meanings.sent2: The skreegh of the brakes echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The skreegh of the violin made the audience cover their ears.
meanings.sent4: The skreegh of the seagulls filled the air by the beach.
meanings.sent5: The skreegh of the chalk on the blackboard made the students cringe.
